edu.cs495.engine.gfx.obj.filters

Class RotationFilter

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.cs495.engine.gfx.obj.filters.AbstractFilter
      • edu.cs495.engine.gfx.obj.filters.RotationFilter

  • public class RotationFilter
extends AbstractFilter
    A pixel rotation filter which can rotate an image around a point
    Version:
    February 2019
    Author:
    Spencer Imbleau

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      RotationFilter()
      Initialize a blank rotation filter
      RotationFilter(Image image, double theta, java.awt.Point anchor)
      Creates a rotation filter

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int[] apply()
      Rotate the pixels of a given image and return them Note: Image bounds are NOT modified, so if the image bounds cannot rotate the object fully within its own bounds, the filtered pixels will be clipped out of the image.
      double getAbsTheta()
      Returns theta + 2pi to always return a positive radian
      double getTheta()
      Returns the angle theta of rotation (in radians) counter-clockwise
      void setAnchor(java.awt.Point anchor)
      Sets a new anchor point to rotate the image around.
      void setTheta(double theta)
      Sets the rotation angle CCW to theta (in radians)

        setImage

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

                      double theta,
                      java.awt.Point anchor)
        Creates a rotation filter
        Parameters:
        image - - The image which is being rotated
        degrees - - The degrees to rotate the object
        anchor - - a point which is used to rotate the image about

      • RotationFilter

        public RotationFilter()
        Initialize a blank rotation filter

    • Method Detail

      • apply

        public int[] apply()
        Rotate the pixels of a given image and return them Note: Image bounds are NOT modified, so if the image bounds cannot rotate the object fully within its own bounds, the filtered pixels will be clipped out of the image.
        Specified by:
        apply in class AbstractFilter
        Parameters:
        image - - the Image to rotate
        Returns:
        a filtered array of pixel data

      • getTheta

        public double getTheta()
        Returns the angle theta of rotation (in radians) counter-clockwise
        Returns:
        the rotation in degrees CCW

      • getAbsTheta

        public double getAbsTheta()
        Returns theta + 2pi to always return a positive radian
        Returns:
        the rotation in degrees CCW

      • setTheta

        public void setTheta(double theta)
        Sets the rotation angle CCW to theta (in radians)
        Parameters:
        theta - - the CCW rotation theta to set

      • setAnchor

        public void setAnchor(java.awt.Point anchor)
        Sets a new anchor point to rotate the image around. If the point is out of bounds, it defaults to the center of the image.
        Parameters:
        anchor - - a point which is used to rotate the image about
